title: Ok boys I need some help
body: Okay guys i got a pretty boss ass computer, i have intel i7 core 5820k processor, 16gb of ram, asus sabertooth x99 mother board, Msi 970 gpu and i cant run this game smoothly on 144fps. Not to mention i have "ASUS VG248QE 24" Full HD 1920x1080 144Hz 1ms HDMI Gaming Monitor". Y in gods name cant i run league of legends on 144 fps, with absolutely no problems? I have messed around with shadows and other shit and it seems to not work. I have horrible ping issues despite my top of the line wireless adapter, so if anyone could throw some insight my way about what may be the case that would be great.

replies.body:
Your PC might actually be too good!  Actually, this may be caused for a few reasons which are mostly settings or outside sources.  As an example, a recent Windows update auto-enabled the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html).  Unfortunately, it's causing big fps issues for some players.  Disabling that as your first step could do the trick!  

If you still have any issues, use our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209010626-Frame-Skipping-on-High-End-PCs) to troubleshoot and make sure that everything is setup properly to run smoothly.  Also as a heads up, keep in mind that we may be unable to support higher resolutions or 4K, so you may need to try reducing that.   Hopefully, these steps get you fixed up!
okay thanks ill check that out

Well, at least in my laptop I have pre-included Intel graphics card as well as my 970m. I had some issues with another game running at awful fps at lowest settings, so I checked my gpu settings and found that I was running on the Intel graphics by default. Switched that and now get beautiful fps at max settings. Perhaps your issue could be similar.. ?

Not real sure what the prolbem could be have you tried checking or unchecking the boxes at the bottom like the vertical sync?  Im currently having prolbems launching so i cant tell you excatly how i have mine set up but all the graphics are on the highest setting, i have a asus Rog G751 jt laptop. i7-4710hq 2.5gGHz (turbo up to 3.5Ghz) Haswell, 16gb DDR3L 1600 MHz, 1 TB 7200 RPM + 256 GB SSD, GTX970M and im running around 300 fps still with everything on the highest setting so you should be doing just as good, i would try messing around a little more with the in game setting like i said or mess around with the setting on the graphics card make sure none of the power save options are cause mine was and it will cut the fps down alot. Hope something i said might help you out
do you know of any way i can see my GPU settings
ok wow really helpful, currently trying to find the settings for my gpu and make sure its running at full capacity.
